text: Suppression of nuclear factor kappa B and <extra_id_0> CD18 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated leukocyte adhesion to the corneal endothelium by dexamethasone .

PURPOSE : To demonstrate that leukocyte adhesion to cultured corneal endothelial cells is mediated by the <extra_id_0> CD18 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antigen , and to determine whether dexamethasone directly suppresses adhesion by inhibiting activation of nuclear factor kappa B ( NFkappaB ) .

METHODS : Cultured bovine corneal endothelium was stimulated for 6 hours by 40 micron / ml <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .
Dexamethasone was added 1 hour before <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> stimulation in the dexamethasone group .
After stimulation , neutrophils separated from a healthy human volunteer were added with or without anti - <extra_id_0> CD18 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibody .
The culture plate was settled for 15 minutes at 37 degrees C , and then neutrophils were activated by N - formyl-methionyl-leucyl-phenylalanine for 5 minutes .
Nonadherent neutrophils were removed by sealing and inverting the culture well .

The intracellular localization of NFkappaB after <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> simulation was determined by confocal immunocytochemistry using an anti - <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibody .

RESULTS : Neutrophil adhesion to cultured corneal endothelial cells increased significantly on exposure to <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 451.4+ / -45.4 cells / mm2 , n = 16 ) compared to control ( 156.7+ / -27.3 cells / mm2 , n = 16 , P < 0.01 ) .

This increased adhesion was suppressed by the addition of anti - <extra_id_0> CD18 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibody ( 157.6+ / -25.1 cells / mm2 , n = 8 , P < 0.01 ) and by pretreatment with 10 ( -7 ) M dexamethasone ( 207.9+ / -31.5 cells / mm2 , n = 10 , P < 0.01 ) .

Immunocytochemistry 60 minutes after stimulation revealed that NFkappaB was located in the cytoplasm in unstimulated cells ; however , the addition of <extra_id_0> TNFalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> caused NFkappaB to translocate into the nucleus .
Pretreatment with dexamethasone tapered NFkappaB translocation into the nucleus .
CONCLUSIONS : Leukocyte adhesion to the corneal endothelium was shown to be mediated by <extra_id_0> CD18 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expressed on activated leukocytes .
Pretreatment of the endothelium with dexamethasone inhibited leukocyte adhesion ; this may be due in part to the suppression of NFkappaB entry into the nucleus .
